items.title: Let the Postpandemic City Grow Wild
items.abstract: Cities contain too many perfected, simplified forms of nature, ones that look pretty but are biologically impoverished.

items.title: Billions in Climate Deal Funding Could Help Protect U.S. Coastal Cities
items.abstract: Communities across the country hope to tap into funds from Democrats’ new climate law to restore coastal habitats, part of a program that emphasizes nature-based solutions.

items.title: A Rural Patch of Hong Kong Where Rare Birds Sing and Developers Circle
items.abstract: A bucolic corner of Hong Kong attracts bird-watchers and bicyclists eager to escape the crowds. But the area is increasingly attractive to developers.

items.title: Eagles, Beavers, Sea Turtles: Why N.Y.C. Is Humming With Wildlife
items.abstract: New York is now ‘the greenest big city on earth,’ one naturalist said. Some creatures have noticed, and are staying for a while.

items.title: Scientists Glimpse New York’s Perilous Path in an Ancient Patch of Marsh
items.abstract: In a rare urban remnant of wetlands and its 1,500 years of sediment, climate experts find more proof of rising seas, a looming hazard for much of the region.
